text: Debjit Majumder (born 6 March 1988) is an Indian professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper. ==Early life== Majumder hails from a small town Hindmotor, near Kolkata. ==Playing career== ===Early years=== Majumder spent early years at Uttarpara Netaji Brigade team under coach Anup Nag. He started his career at Calcutta Football League (CFL) with Food Corporation of India (FCI) football team. He went on to play for teams like United Sikkim and Kalighat MS. ===East Bengal=== Majumder joined East Bengal for 2011–12 season and made 4 appearances. ===Bhawanipore=== Majumder played for I-League 2nd Division team, Bhawanipore F.C. for two seasons and the team came close to promotion during 2014 season. ===Mohun Bagan=== Majumder was signed as replacement keeper by Mohun Bagan in 2014, as Shilton Paul was loaned to Chennaiyin FC. Majumder was awarded man of the match for his performance against East Bengal on 28 March 2015 in Kolkata derby. As a result of his stellar performances during the current season, he was selected the Best Goalkeeper of I-League 2015. In 2015-16 I-League season, Majumder used as the number 1 goalkeeper and also played AFC Champions League Qualifier game against Tampines Rovers FC & Shandong Luneng Taishan. He was also awarded the FPAI Fans Player of the Year award in the 2015-16 season. ====Mumbai City (loan)==== In July 2015 Majumder was drafted to play for Mumbai City FC in the 2015 Indian Super League. ====Atlético de Kolkata (loan)==== On 4 July 2016, Atlético de Kolkata confirmed that Debjit has signed on the dotted lines on loan from Mohun Bagan for third season of Hero ISL.http://www.indiansuperleague-news.com/indian-super-league-debjit-majumder- set-to-join-atletico-de-kolkata/ ===ATK=== In July 2017, Kolkata has retained AIFF Goalkeeper of the year Debjit Majumder for 3 years. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Federation Cup !colspan="2"|Durand Cup !colspan="2"|AFC !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !CS !Apps !CS !Apps !CS !Apps !CS !Apps !CS |- |JCT Mills Phagwara |2010-11 |17||2||3||0||0||0||4||0||24||2 |- |rowspan=2|Bhawanipore |2013 |–||–||–||–||–||–||–||–||–||– |- |2014 |–||–||–||–||–||–||–||–||–||– |- |Mohun Bagan |2014-15 |16||9||0||0||0||0||0||0||18||9 |- |Mumbai City |2015 |2||0||0||0||0||0||–||–||2||0 |- |Mohun Bagan |2015-16 |8||1||0||0||0||0||2||1||10||2 |- |Atletico de Kolkata |2016 |16||0||0||0||0||0||–||–||16||0 |- |Mohun Bagan |2016-17 |17||1||0||0||0||0||2||1||10||2 |- !
